AFCS OPERATION Embraer Legacy 450/500 and Praetor 500/600 Approach Modes Pro Line Fusion® Avionics

• Selected courses are NOT equal.

If any of above statements is true, and the pilots push the APPR button, LOC and GS modes are armed on the lateral and the vertical axis, respectively, as well as in APPR 2, but in this case, APPR 1 will be displayed as it is armed on the FMA.

LOC mode will activate and will command the capture and tracking of the beam, when the airplane is sufﬁciently close to the localizer beam, as follows.

• Once the airplane is sufﬁciently close to the GS beam, GS mode will activate. Depending on the scenario, APPR 1 may be activated at this time, or it may still be displayed as armed until the airplane descends below 800 ft radio altitude.

The ﬁrst scenario (when APPR 1 may be activated) will occur if APPR 2 is not capable, as followed. The second scenario (when APPR 1 may still be displayed as armed) will occur if APPR 2 is capable.
